channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: Collingwood face Melbourne in the twilight clash at the Gabba in what looms as a crucial match for the finals hopes of both sides.
item.title: AFL Round 12 live updates: Melbourne Demons running riot against shellshocked Collingwood Magpies, Brody Mihocek knocked out cold

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: North Melbourne coach Rhyce Shaw has had a change of mindset about list management on a day Lion Charlie Cameron was put under the microscope.
item.title: Debate over North rebuild as Fagan defends Cameron

item.dc:creator: The Age's View
item.description: Healthcare workers not only have a right to work in a safe environment, but we need them to keep us alive too. Every infected healthcare worker cannot work once diagnosed, and their close-contact colleagues cannot work either for 14 days. Repeat that scenario too many times and all of a sudden we won’t have enough workers to keep our healthcare system running.
item.title: We must protect our healthcare workers

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Sydney University players tuning in from isolation could only watch in horror as the Students fell late to Southern Districts in a thrilling match.
item.title: Southern Districts spark upset over depleted Sydney University outfit

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: A female surfer has been released from the jaws of a shark after her husband punched it during an attack on the NSW Mid North Coast on Saturday morning.
item.title: Surfer defends wife from shark attack on Mid North Coast

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: He's established himself as one of the NRL's top wingers, but Josh Addo-Carr wants to switch to fullback when he shifts to a Sydney club in 2021.
item.title: Addo-Carr reveals shock ambition to play fullback next year

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: North Pacific was made favourite for the Golden Rose and Caulfield Guineas after a devastating Up And Coming Stakes win at Randwick on Saturday.
item.title: Secret out after North Pacific's slashing win in Up and Coming Stakes

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The Giants and Queensland Firebirds played the first draw of the season on Saturday after both clubs lost their nerve in the closing stages of a thrilling encounter.
item.title: Giants, Firebirds share spoils as late chances go begging

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A neighbour ran into a burning building to try to save a young boy after fire engulfed a third-storey apartment at a Fitzroy North public housing building on Saturday.
item.title: Neighbour tried to save young boy trapped in fatal public housing blaze

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The Australian Test side could be playing deep into January, as part of a range of contingencies being explored by Cricket Australia for next season.
item.title: Season could be flipped: CA exploring fixture overhaul for next summer

item.description: It's Narromine Cup day in the NSW Central West with a nine-race card to wrap up the week.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Narromine on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: On the big days it's the big players whom come to the fore, and Godolphin proved it was ready for the spring when it took the two features at Caulfield.
item.title: Godolphin, Cummings and Zahra star with Caulfield double

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: An online survey of hundreds of residents included calls for the privately owned former ABC site on the river in the area to be transformed into parkland.
item.title: Residents fear Toowong is becoming an 'overdeveloped' car park

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: North Melbourne answered coach Rhyce Shaw's call to show some fight at Metricon Stadium on Saturday but still fell to their eighth loss in their past nine matches, this time to the Brisbane Lions.
item.title: Hop to it: Lions hang on by a point as Kangaroos reclaim respect

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: As the "shaken" Panther mulled over lodging a legal complaint, the NRL threatened life bans for those who allegedly hurled racial abuse on Friday.
item.title: 'Shell-shocked' Naden weighs police complaint about alleged racial abuse

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to present major issues for governments around the country as the lessons from aged care, the Ruby Princess cruise ship and hotel quarantine program.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Victoria records four deaths, 303 new cases on Saturday, NSW seeks lower cases, Australian death toll at 375

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The AFL will develop a set of key criteria to assess various state government proposals to host the grand final if, as expected, the door eventually slams shut on the MCG.
item.title: Grand final call about more than money as states intensify lobbying

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: A Melbourne council's proposal to ban fire-pits and outdoor ovens has been described as "nonsensical" by some residents.
item.title: 'Nonsensical': Bayside council considers ban on BBQs, backyard fires

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: City of Port Phillip councillor Andrew Bond says the St Kilda Festival, which brings millions into the city each February, could be postponed due to COVID-19.
item.title: 2021 St Kilda Festival could be postponed due to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Victoria has recorded 303 new coronavirus cases in the past 24 hours, continuing the state's downward trend in daily infections.
item.title: 'People should have hope': Victoria records 303 new coronavirus cases

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Kevin Proctor has the infamous distinction of becoming the first NRL player to be sent off for biting an opponent.
item.title: Shark bite: Titans enforcer Proctor becomes first player sent off for biting

item.dc:creator: Sandra Hall
item.description: You’re not far in before you’re pushed to the conclusion that suburban New Orleans, where the film was shot, must have the doziest police force in the world.
item.title: Russell Crowe truly terrifying in new film Unhinged

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Human rights commissioner Edward Santow has sounded the alarm about the growing use of automated decisions by government agencies.
item.title: Human Rights Commission warns government over 'dangerous' use of AI

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Berejiklian government is maintaining radio silence on the report into the Ruby Princess debacle until next week, despite the report finding "serious mistakes" in NSW Health's response.
item.title: Berejiklian government keeps Ruby Princess passengers waiting after damning findings

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: In the most turbulent and chaotic of AFL seasons, there has been one constant - Port Adelaide have held down the top spot on the ladder since the season began.
item.title: Round by round ladder moves show contrasting fortunes in Adelaide

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Jim Crute will likely return in October in Vegas or the Middle East but would be happy to fight in Antarctica, such is his desire to get back in the octagon.
item.title: Crute not letting lockdown get in the way of UFC return

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: In a statement, an Alfred Health spokesperson said the recently advertised role was for a customer support officer whose role is to check through packages arriving at hotels: a role which requires a security licence.
item.title: Alfred Health seeks casual security guards for hotel quarantine roles

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From a science trail to a new exhibition by Patricia Piccinini and Love and War with Opera Australia, we have your week in Sydney covered.
item.title: Best of the week: what to see, hear and do from August 16-22

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: The musician has been catching up with The Gilmore Girls and Taylor Swift and looking after her mum at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: What keeps musician Clare Bowditch entertained

item.dc:creator: Candice Chung
item.description: A former Rockpool chef spent weeks on bus trips criss-crossing Lebanon, eating at local joints and researching for his menu.
item.title: Jimmy's Falafel survived a shutdown, now its food is a sell-out hit

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: The 29-year-old actor didn't even know who the famed music journalist was before she started filming the Helen Reddy biopic I Am Woman.
item.title: 'She was a true force': Danielle Macdonald gives Lillian Roxon her due

item.dc:creator: Gabriella Coslovich
item.description: Primary school children understand the value of shouting out loud.
item.title: Gabriella Coslovich: how to play the yelling game

item.description: Victoria Hannan's award-winning first novel is both tender and brutal, skillful and empathic.
item.title: A timely song of secrets, sex and the meaning of love

item.description: I love Grant. Should I tell him about my brief fling for the sake of honesty?
item.title: About Last Night: Should I confess my affair?

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: In his new documentary, Steven Oliver presents a home-grown perspective on Captain Cook's arrival 250 years ago.
item.title: Steven Oliver gets serious with Looky Looky Here Comes Cooky

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Critics' Choice: Family Feud, The Great Acceleration, Australian Ninja Warrior: State of Origin, The Politician
item.title: TV Critic's Choice for August 16

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Saturday Picks: Only Connect, Father Brown, The Children's Hospital
item.title: TV for Saturday, August 22

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Friday Picks: Neighbours, The Good Girls' Guide to Kinky Sex, Gardening Australia
item.title: TV for Friday, August 21

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Thursday Picks: The World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys, Cat Tales, Territory Cops
item.title: TV for Thursday, August 20

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Wednesday Picks: Luther, American Dad!, The Bachelor Australia
item.title: TV for Wednesday, August 19

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Tuesday Picks: Great Asian Railway Journeys, Fight for Planet A, Anh's Brush with Fame: Anna Meares
item.title: TV for Tuesday, August 18

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Monday Picks: The Blitz: Britain on Fire, Lidia's Italy, Farmer Wants a Wife
item.title: TV for Monday, August 17

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Sunday Picks: Egypt's Lost Pyramid, Liar, FBI
item.title: TV for Sunday, August 16

item.description: PAY TV: Lovecraft Country examines racism in the US through the prism of a classic horror movie
item.title: PAY TV: Lovecraft Country explores racism through horror

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Favourites fail to deliver in the Vain Stakes and Quezette Quality, as improvers from the Price-Kent and Dabernig-Hayes stables upset the apple cart.
item.title: Favourites bubbles burst as Our Playboy and Bella Nipotina land spoils

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: There is absolutely no smiling in footy rooms post-defeat, the air heavy with a dreadful disquietude as once invigorated, vibrant athletes slump helplessly against walls.
item.title: 'Stay cool in the heat': the psychological impact of losing

item.description: In a televised speech, Moon said that his government has “left the door of consultations wide open” for Japan to settle a long legal and diplomatic dispute.
item.title: South Korea's Moon extends olive branch to Tokyo over wartime history

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The proposed bill, now scrapped, will not be returning now or after the election, the Premier says.
item.title: Premier takes 'full responsibility' for axed CCC media gag proposal

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: A desperate comeback effort from Collingwood wasn't enough to stop the West Coast Fever.
item.title: Magpies lose nail-biter to Fever

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Geelong key forward Tom Hawkins is in the best shape of his career according to Cats' coach Chris Scott after the 32-year-old took an outright lead in the Coleman Medal.
item.title: Hawkins in tip, top shape: Chris Scott
